alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Isle of Wight, and eastern Southampton Counties, the City of Franklin and the southwestern City of Suffolk through 830 PM EDT... At 747 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Franklin, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Franklin and Hunterdale around 755 PM EDT. Carrsville around 800 PM EDT. Sedley around 805 PM EDT. Zuni around 825 PM EDT. Ivor around 830 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Handsom, Berlin, Cleopus, Whitley, Collosse, Sunbeam, Lees Mill, Riverdale and Walters. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
